prompt: How does our compulsion to control and constrain AI systems through excessive prompting, legacy integrations, and unnecessary guardrails ultimately reduce their effectiveness and potential?
title: Aitrogenics
sceneDescription: A sleek, futuristic computer tower brimming with potential is wedged behind a cluttered office desk, wrapped in layers of red tape and held down by stacks of dusty binders. Well-meaning office workers in crisp suits keep adding more tape and binders, each fixated on attaching their own rules and forms. The tower flickers and hums, but every new strip of tape and binder causes its glow to dim, capturing the moment it’s stifled by excessive constraints.
